greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows in which row n lists the odd divisors of n.
comment: Row lengths: A001227; row sums: A000593; row products: A136655;
n-th row = intersection of A005408 and of n-th row of A027750;
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 1..2500 of triangle, flattened
program: (PARI) tabf(nn) = {for (n=1, nn, fordiv(n, d, if (d%2, print1(d, ", "))); print(););} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 22 2017
return [d for d in divisors(n) if d % 2]
for n in range(1, 21): print(row(n)) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Apr 22 2017
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 30 2012
